hypothesis: 1:1 ordering at both A- and B-sublattices combined with a+ a+ c– octahedral rotations in AA′BB′O6 structures leads_to insulating ferro- and ferrimagnetic behavior with semiconducting band gaps suitable for optoelectronic and spintronic applications

predictions: LaA′MnNiO6 DDPOs will exhibit semiconducting band gaps between 1.3 eV and 1.9 eV
They will crystallize in tetragonal centrosymmetric P4_2/n symmetry
They will be ferromagnetic or ferrimagnetic insulators
Magnetic transition temperatures will range from 70 K to 242 K
Phonon dispersions will show only negligible imaginary modes (<2 cm⁻¹)
